Title: Design and Evaluation of Efficient Bandwidth Management for a Corporate Network
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS-Master of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wairisal, M., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS-Master of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Surantha, N., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, BINUS-Master of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Problem that usually occurs at every company is a network performance problem, e.g. low throughput and inefficient bandwidth utilization. Those parameters are not well calculated that leads to wasteful costs if we keep doing the continuous bandwidth upgrades. In this paper we propose a new network design method for corporate network. The design is performed using top-down network design that considers the business and technical goals of the corporate. In order to improve the bandwidth utilization efficiency, we evaluate few traffic shaping methods in terms of bandwidth utilization, packet loss, and latency. The experiment results show that the proposed design using per-connection queue (PCQ) traffic shaping method achieves the best performance among all of the evaluated scenarios. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: network design; PCQ; QOS; traffic shaping
Index Keywords: Bandwidth; Information management; Quality of service; Band-width utilization; Corporate networks; Design and evaluations; Efficient bandwidth; Network design; Topdown; Traffic-shaping; Design
